thread.title: Cate Blanchett has put her $20 million Sydney home on the market
thread.title_full: Cate Blanchett has put her $20 million Sydney home on the market

author: Jen Melocco Network Real Estate reporter
title: Cate Blanchett has put her $20 million Sydney home on the market
text:
CATE Blanchett and her family are set to sell their palatial Hunters Hill waterfront home with the historic mansion, known as Bulwarra, expected to attract bids of around $20 million.
The move comes as the family look to sell up in Sydney and move to the US as Blanchett’s husband Andrew Upton finishes his time as director of the Sydney Theatre Company. Cate Blanchett husband Andrew Upton are selling their Hunters Hill home. Source: Supplied
The couple bought the property on the exclusive Hunters Hill peninsula in 2005 for $10 million and have shared it with their four children Dashiell, Roman, Ignatius and daughter Edith.
The property is listed with leading prestige agent Ken Jacobs of Christies International, who recently sold Jamie Packer’s $60 million plus Vaucluse home.
He said the Blanchett home was unique and he expected to attract a lot of interest. The historic property has undergone an $8 million renovation and now has a modern streamlined wing. Source: News Limited
“It’s in its own category,” said Mr Jacobs.
“It’s a beautiful sandstone mansion that has been revitalised and there is a seamless transition between the old and new.”
The large two-storey home sits on a massive 3642sqm of land. Cate Blanchett, husband Andrew Upton and children are selling up as they move to the US. Source: News Corp Australia
The couple have transformed the historic home that was built in 1877 and was once owned by the Arnotts family.
The international movie star and her theatre director husband have added a modern wing with staff quarters, in a renovation that was estimated to have cost around $8 million.
With a north-facing aspect, the home is also in a secluded position making it perfect for the Oscar winning actor and her family. There are rolling lawns and designer gardens that have been created by Will Dangar.
“It is unusual to get a property with that land size and a home with such architectural merit and modern functionality,” Mr Jacobs said.
The property is listed for sale through an expressions of interest campaign.
Originally published as Cate Blanchett selling up in Sydney
